name: Tinc GUI
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Android port of tinc VPN with basic GUI
body:
## Welcome to Tinc GUI for Android home page.
Tinc is an open source peer to peer VPN daemon. Find more information at http://www.tinc-vpn.org.

Tinc GUI for Android is a [(slightly modified)](https://github.com/Vilbrekin/tinc) cross-compiled version of tincd for Arm, associated with a basic GUI for daemon management.

## How does it work?
As this is a simple GUI around the original tincd daemon, please refer to the [official documentation](http://www.tinc-vpn.org/documentation/tinc_4.html#Configuration) for the configuration.

The easiest solution is to build your configuration and store it on your external SD card.
Because Android devices usually mount it with noexec flag, a new option has been added to tinc's configuration file, in order to specify the script interpreter to use for configuration scripts (instead of having them executable):
```
# Use sh to execute all configuration scripts
ScriptsInterpreter = /system/bin/sh
```

## FAQ
### Why does this application need SuperUser rights?
It doesn't really need them by itself (there's an option to disable it).
However tincd daemon will most probably need super user rights to work properly: access to TUN/TAP device is usually restricted to root.

### What are the supported CPU architectures?
ARM only for the time being.

### Is it working?
Very well on my SGS2 i9100, under CyanogenMod 9. 
Waiting for more feedback.

### Is it free?
Yes, it's even released under GPLv3. [Source code is available on GitHub](https://github.com/Vilbrekin/tinc_gui).
However if you like this application and want to support it, you might [donate to the author](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=L8H64G57CZRZA).
